node.title: David Warner has been more brilliant than controversial
node.alt: Three Australian cricketers embrace after their team wins the T20 World Cup final.
node.description: Far from a cricketing choirboy, David Warner's influence in the sport has once again been shown to be more than just controversy and he's once and for all etched his name into the sport's folklore, writes Paul Johnson.
node.content:
["Not for the first time in his career, David Warner turned up for his country when it needed him most.", "So\u00a0devoid of form coming into this World Cup was the 35-year-old opener that his Indian Premier League side Sunrisers Hyderabad actually dropped him.", "However, when it mattered most \u2014 and Warner pulled on the gold and green of Australia \u2014 he once again delivered in consistent fashion and it should be no surprise that the left-handed opener was named Player of the Tournament.", "While leg-spinner Adam Zampa had the best figures of\u00a0the tournament, taking 5-19 against\u00a0Bangladesh, and\u00a0was generally economical he hardly turned the course of many games and the same could be said for his fellow bowlers.", "Warner, though, was everywhere \u2014\u00a0and, yes, in the final the big-hitting of man-of-the-match Mitch Marsh was the cherry on the top of Australia's delicious latest victory over perennial major tournament bridesmaid's New Zealand \u2014 Warner largely set that up by laying a good foundation as his\u00a0captain and opening partner, Aaron Finch, once again departed cheaply.", "", "
David Warner's 53 off 38 balls set the platform for Australia's T20 World Cup final triumph against New Zealand.(Getty Images: ICC/Matthew Lewis)
", "Warner's 53 was valuable, him being there and playing well allowed Marsh to go into all-out attack mode and his innings laid the platform for Australia's eventual triumph.", "The same could be said in the semi-final against Pakistan\u00a0when, once again,\u00a0cometh the moment, cometh the moustachioed man.", "Of course, at the end of the innings that was wicketkeeper Matthew Wade as he belted 41 off 17 deliveries to ramp\u00a0Australia to victory\u00a0but for the most part it was Warner.", "At that point in time, Australia was\u00a0faced with the biggest run chase in this World Cup, needing to score 177 after Pakistan had taken Australia's bowlers to the cleaners.", "Shaheen Shah Afridi was bowling unplayable stuff early and removed Finch for a duck, Warner, though, saw it off then prospered as he plundered 49 off 10 overs, before being given out to a ball he did not hit.", "Yet the post-match talk was not of that but, rather, how Warner hit a Mohammad Hafeez double-bouncer for a massive six.", "Former India batsman Gautam\u00a0Gambhir took the cheapest route possible and labelled the incident not in the spirit of the game, suggesting Warner should not have dispatched the double-bouncing dolly nearly all the way to the top tier of the 'Ring of Fire'.", "\"What an absolutely pathetic display of spirit of the game by Warner! #Shameful\" Gambhir tweeted.", "Gambhir insisted his comments were made in response to past criticism levelled at India spinner Ravichandrin Ashwin for making use of the Mankad mode of dismissal, where the bowler runs out the batter\u00a0while they\u00a0are\u00a0backing up at the non-striker's end.", "Still, making them against Warner \u2014\u00a0who has routinely courted controversy throughout a career played on the edge \u2014 was picking on an easy target and a target who was trying to win his side their first Twenty20 World Cup.", "Achieving that goal is just another accolade in what has been a stellar career and one that should be regarded as memorable, not because of the controversies but because of the brilliance.", "Certainly, 2013 was an annus horribilis, with his attack on Joe Root a career lowlight, and the 2018 Tour of South Africa was far from Warner's greatest hits parade.", "It started with the confrontation with South Africa wicketkeeper Quinton de Kock, where the pair allegedly engaged in an unsavoury verbal sparring session which almost got physical before 'Sandpapergate' ensued and Warner, Steve Smith and Cameron Bancroft all received lengthy and over-the-top bans for the cricketing crime of ball-tampering.", "Warner and Smith were given 12 month bans each when other players to do so in the game were frequently given much lighter punishments, usually fines,\u00a0among them former\u00a0South Africa captain Faf du Plessis.", "But now, three years later, Warner has once again proved himself to be almost peerless with the bat when he was most needed.", "He averaged 48.16, scoring 289 runs across seven innings. The only real failure came against England when their quicks ripped through Australia and he made 1 in a humiliating loss, but the rest of it after that \u2014\u00a0when it was do or die for his country \u2014\u00a0was brilliant.", "In must-win matches against West Indies,\u00a0Pakistan and New Zealand, he made 89 not out, 49 and 53 respectively and those innings go with countless other accolades throughout his career.", "Warner has made 5,000 runs and 50 dismissals in the field, in both the Test and ODI arenas, made the fifth-highest Test score ever, 335 not out.", "When it comes to limited overs, Warner has made the second-most ODI hundreds in a calendar year, with seven in 2019 \u2014\u00a0only Sachin Tendulkar has more \u2014 and was the fourth-fastest player to 5,000 ODI runs behind prolific run-machines Hashim Amla, Viv Richards and Virat Kohli.", "And with Test, ODI and T20 international averages of 48.09, 45.45 and 32.74, Warner\u00a0already stands apart from many of his peers.", "Now he's been Australia's most influential player in a piece of sporting history for a great sporting nation, it might well be the crowning moment on a glittering career that's been more brilliant than controversial."]
